intro: Alberta sambiranensis var. australis, commonly known as the southern Alberta sambiranensis, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
